column356: The move to hybrid or electric cars sounds all well and good.  But is it possible?  I live in a rural area on a disability pension. The only form of public transport is the school bus.  Are we going to be able to afford an electric or hybrid vehicle?  Or is there going to be sufficient public transport for people in rural areas?  Please don't get me wrong,  I fully support greener energy,  and transport.   We have had solar power panels installed.   That was a major effort considering that both my husband and myself are on a disability pension.   I would love to be able to afford an electric or hybrid vehicle,  but if it is a law, I believe that the government has a responsibility to help those in lower income groups, as long as the lower income groups makes a conscious effort to make the majority contribution to those type of vehicles.
